history.content: If you have even the minimal amount of statistical background (e.g. AP Stats in high school), you should be fine with just 61A/B for Data 100. The part of Data 100 that involves writing code is fairly easy after having taken those classes. I would say that if you do skip Data 8 you should familiarize yourself with Pandas, Numpy, and iPython notebooks since these are used pretty regularly in the class.

children.subject: Have you taken ee16ab? Otherwise, are you familiar with Numpy? I took 61a with data8 concurrently and felt that data8 was not strong as a course and was very broad. My recommendation would be for you to go over the notes during the summer in your own time and do the labs. It is kind of a waste of time to take the class if you already took 61a because the few things you learn are very easy to self-study. So yeah, I would just self-study it and take Data 100

history.content:
Is it worth taking Data 8 if I have already taken CS61A and 61B?

I would like to take Data 100 in the future (maybe this fall) but I'm not sure if I should take Data 8 first or self study it over the summer and fill out the prerequisite form?
history.subject: Data 8?
